def: Measurement of distance or altitude by a staff or staffs.
The pronunciation of the Greek Ãª (eta) like the Italian e long,that is like a in the English word ate. See Itacism.
A kind of shell marble occurring in the Wealden clay atPetworth, in Sussex, England; -- called also Sussex marble.
A large bedstead with tall posts at the corners to supportcurtains. [Colloq.]

To lift or raise aloft; to raise; to elevate; as, to uplift thearm; to uplift a rock. Cowper.Satan, talking to his nearest mate, With head uplift above the wave,and eyes That sparkling blazed. Milton.
A kind of red pepper. See Capsicum [Written also chilli andchile.]
To reckon below what is right or proper; to underrate. Bp.Hall.
A small tower, fort, or castle; a keep. [Scot.]
Of or pertaining to Geneva, in Switzerland; Genevan.-- n. sing. & pl.
